To the cloudy solution of step 2 was added a mixture of 3 mg each of Compound I

3 polymorphs (Form II, III, Ilia, IV, V, VI, VII, VIII, IX, X, XI, and XII).

Stirred the slurry in the step 3 for 6 h at 25 °C: partial slurry was filtered and

4 analyzed by XRPD, which showed Form I.

Stirred the slurry in the step 3 for 18 h at 25 °C: partial slurry was filtered and

5 analyzed by XRPD, which showed Form I.

Example A: LSD1 histone demethylase biochemical assay

LANCE LSD1/KDM1A demethylase assay- 10 μί of 1 nM LSD-1 enzyme (ENZO BML-SE544-0050) in the assay buffer (50 mM Tris, pH 7.5, 0.01% Tween-20, 25 mM NaCl, 5 mM DTT) were pre-incubated for 1 hour at 25 °C with 0.8 compound/DMSO dotted in black 384 well polystyrene plates. Reactions were started by addition of 10 of assay buffer containing 0.4 μΜ Biotin-labeled Histone H3 peptide substrate: ART-K(Mel)- QTARKSTGGKAPRKQLA-GGK(Biotin) SEQ ID NO: l (AnaSpec 64355) and incubated for 1 hour at 25°C. Reactions were stopped by addition of 10 μί IX LANCE Detection Buffer (PerkinElmer CR97- 100) supplemented with 1.5 nM Eu-anti-unmodified H3K4 Antibody (PerkinElmer TRF0404), and 225 nM LANCE Ultra Streptavidin (PerkinElmer TRF102) along with 0.9 mM Tranylcypromine-HCl (Millipore 616431). After stopping the reactions plates were incubated for 30 minutes and read on a PHERAstar FS plate reader (BMG Labtech). The salts of the present disclosure have been tested and found to be active against LSD1 with an IC50 less than 100 nM.
